books.title: The Triumph of the Scarlet Pimpernel
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A woman is kidnapped in order to trap her husband.

books.title: The Secret of the Old Mill
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: The police are out of their depth as counterfeit bills circulate through the city, but two amateur sleuths are on the case.

books.title: You Can’t Win
books.author: Jack Black
books.summary: Jack Black’s autobiographical account of life “on the road” as a professional thief and hobo during the late 19th century and early 20th century.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Pollyanna
books.author: Eleanor H. Porter
books.summary: An orphan’s unrelenting optimism sees her through adversity and lifts up her new community.

books.title: Something New
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Two young writers experience romance and adventure in Lord Emsworth’s Blandings Castle.

books.title: Henry IV, Part I
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King Henry IV faces Welsh and Scottish rebels while English royals plot to betray their own king.

books.title: The Water of the Wondrous Isles
books.author: William Morris
books.summary: A beautiful woman escapes a life of servitude under an evil witch to adventure through a series of magical islands.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.summary: Inflated by his own ambition, an ex-student murders a pawnbroker, then faces the inevitable consequences.

books.title: The Vampire
books.author: John William Polidori
books.summary: A London gentleman goes on an ill-fated trip with a mysterious and sinister newcomer.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: Uncle Silas
books.author: J. Sheridan Le Fanu
books.summary: An heiress becomes ward to her disreputable uncle with an unsavory past, tainted by the apparent suicide of a man to whom he owed a large gambling debt, and must help clear his name.

books.title: The Public and Its Problems
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: A discussion of the political philosophy of a democratic society.

books.title: A Vindication of the Rights of Woman
books.author: Mary Wollstonecraft
books.summary: Wollstonecraft argues for equal treatment of women in society, especially in matters of education.

books.title: The Odyssey
books.author: Homer
books.summary: An epic poem following a Greek hero trying to return home after the Trojan war.

books.title: The Indiscreet Jewels
books.author: Denis Diderot
books.summary: The Sultan of the Congo brings about philosophical inquiry and scandal when he is granted a magical ring that permits him to compel speech from the vaginas of the women of his court.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Walter M. Miller Jr.
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Walter M. Miller Jr., ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: A Thief in the Night
books.author: E. W. Hornung
books.summary: The gentleman thief’s pal reminisces on past adventures in this third collection of A. J. Raffles stories.

books.title: Orthodoxy
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton’s unique view on Christianity and how all his “solitary and sincere speculations” were ultimately answered by its theology.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.
